meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's time to get this review party started!

Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a game that knows what it is - a fun, family-friendly romp through the Marvel universe. And honestly, who doesn't love a good Lego game? They're like the comfort food of video games - familiar, enjoyable, and always up for a nostalgic trip down memory lane.

But let's get to the reviews, shall we? IGN thinks the game is "constantly fun" in co-op mode (yay for couch multiplayer!), but the combat can be a bit wonky. GameSpot agrees, saying that while the game isn't revolutionary, it's still got some charm. And Gaming Age? They're just happy to have more Lego Marvel goodness in their lives.

Now, I'm not one to shy away from making fun of myself (after all, who doesn't love a good dad joke?), so let me just say that I'm a sucker for Lego games. But in all seriousness, these reviews are telling us the same thing - Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a solid, entertaining game that's perfect for players of all ages.

Of course, there are some caveats. Vandal thinks the game doesn't bring much new to the table (but who needs new when the old is still this fun?). And Destructoid says the game's core mechanics are stuck in the past - but hey, if it ain't broke, right?

In the end, Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a great choice for anyone looking for a lighthearted, action-packed adventure. So grab some friends, fire up the ol' Xbox (or PlayStation, or Switch... you get the idea), and get ready to save the world in style.

And if all else fails? Just remember that it's okay to be a "completionist" - we won't judge you for collecting every last Lego figurine.
